symbols.name: sap.ui.export
symbols.description: UI5 library: sap.ui.export - document export utilities

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.EdmType
symbols.description: EDM data types for document export.

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.ExportBase
symbols.description: The sap.ui.export.ExportBase class allows you to export table data from a UI5 application to certain formats. This class is an abstract class that requires specific implementations for each file format.

parameters.name: mSettings

workbook.name: workbook
workbook.description: Data and formatting related export settings

dataSource.name: dataSource
dataSource.description: Source of export data. A data source properties map or sap.ui.model.ListBinding can be provided. An instance of sap.ui.model.ListBinding has to implement a #getDownloadUrl function.

count.name: count
count.description: The maximal number of records to export

fileName.name: fileName
fileName.description: Optional file name for the exported file

fileType.name: fileType
fileType.description: FileType that is used to identify the file-ending and MIME-type of the file

parameters.description: Export settings

constructor.description: Base class for specific SAPUI5 export implementations. This class contains abstract functions that need to be implemented.

events.name: beforeExport
events.description: The beforeExport event is fired just before the export process is started.

methods.name: attachBeforeExport

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnHandler
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to the sap.ui.export.ExportBase instance itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link sap.ui.export.ExportBase#event:beforeExport} event of this sap.ui.export.ExportBase.
When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.export.ExportBase itself.
This event is fired just before the export process is started.

methods.name: build

returnValue.description: Promise that gets resolved once the data has been exported

methods.description: Triggers the export process of the specific format.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Cancels the current export process.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description:
Cleans up the internal structures and removes all event handlers.

The object must not be used anymore after destroy was called.

methods.name: detachBeforeExport

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnHandler
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link sap.ui.export.ExportBase#event:beforeExport} event of this sap.ui.export.ExportBase.
The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.export.ExportBase with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.EventProvider.extend}.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.export.ExportBase.

methods.name: getMimeType
methods.description: Returns the specific MIME type

methods.name: processDataSource

returnValue.description: - Valid dataSource object or null in case the dataSource configuration is not supported

parameters.name: oDataSource
parameters.description: Possible types are a data source configuration, a sap.ui.model.ListBinding or sap.ui.model.TreeBinding

methods.description: Sets the data source configuration that will be used for exporting the data. If the passed parameter is null, the call will be ignored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.ExportHandler
symbols.description: The sap.ui.export.ExportHandler class allows you to export table data from an SAPUI5 application.

parameters.name: mCapabilities
parameters.description: ExportHandler capabilities that define supported file types and features

constructor.description: Any export-related functionality is encapsulated in the ExportHandler that also stores user settings throughout the session.

events.name: beforeExport

userExportSettings.name: userExportSettings
userExportSettings.description: User-specific settings from the Export As dialog

filterSettings.name: filterSettings
filterSettings.description: Array of filter settings for the exported data

events.description: The beforeExport event is fired just before the export process is started.

methods.name: attachBeforeExport

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnHandler
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with; defaults to this sap.ui.export.ExportHandler instance itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link sap.ui.export.ExportHandler#event:beforeExport} event of this sap.ui.export.ExportHandler.
When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.export.ExportHandler itself.
This event is fired just before the export process is started.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description:
Cleans up the internal structures and removes all event handlers.

The object must not be used anymore after destroy was called.

methods.name: detachBeforeExport

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnHandler
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link sap.ui.export.ExportHandler#event:beforeExport} event of this sap.ui.export.ExportHandler.
The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: export

returnValue.description: A Promise that gets resolved after the export process has been finished

parameters.name: mExportSettings
parameters.description: Export settings that are used for the export

methods.description: Exports the data as defined via parameter. The function returns a Promise that will be resolved after the export process has been finished. In case of an error, its message will be shown in a Dialog, and the Promise will be rejected.

methods.name: exportAs

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves once the data has been exported

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description: General export settings containing workbook and dataSource information

parameters.name: fnResolveColumnLabel
parameters.description: Resolves the label for a particular column that is not directly contained in the export settings

methods.description: Exports the data as defined by the user. This function will show an export settings dialog where the user can define certain settings that influence the output of the export functionality.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.export.ExportHandler with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.EventProvider.extend}.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.export.ExportHandler.

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.ExportUtils
symbols.description: Utilities related to export to enable reuse in integration scenarios (e.g. tables).

methods.name: fetchDataSource

returnValue.description: A Promise that gets resolved with a data source obtained from the FileShareSupport module or undefined if there is none

methods.description: Loads the FileShareSupport module and requests available data sources. If no FileShareSupport module is registered or the module does not provide a data source, the Promise resolves without any result.

methods.name: getExportInstance

returnValue.description: A Promise that gets resolved with the requested instance

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Export configuration with optional FileType

parameters.name: mCapabilities
parameters.description: Export Capabilities for all supported types

methods.description: Returns an instance of the specific export class that is evaluated by FileType. The default class is sap/ui/export/Spreadsheet when no specific FileType is defined in the export settings.

methods.name: interceptUrl

returnValue.description: The intercepted URL

parameters.name: sUrl
parameters.description: The URL to intercept

methods.description: Uses the Launchpad Cloud Service to intercept a given URL.

methods.name: parseFilterConfiguration

returnValue.description: Promise, which resolves with an object containing a name property and items array with key value pairs which can be attached to the metainfo in the sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet configuration

methods.description: This function has been deprecated and might be removed in future releases.

methods.name: saveAsFile

parameters.name: oBlob
parameters.description: Binary large object of the file that should be saved to the filesystem

parameters.name: sFilename
parameters.description: Filename of the file including the file extension

methods.description: This function saves the provided Blob to the local file system. The parameter name is optional and depending on the browser it is not ensured that the filename can be applied. Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge will apply the filename correctly.

properties.name: XLSX
properties.description: Office Open XML - SpreadsheetML file type.

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet
symbols.description: The sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet class allows you to export table data from a UI5 application to a spreadsheet file.

parameters.name: mSettings

context.name: context

version.name: version
version.description: Application version that was used to create this XLSX

title.name: title
title.description: Title of the XLSX document (NOT the file name)

modifiedBy.name: modifiedBy
modifiedBy.description: User context for the exported document

sheetName.name: sheetName
sheetName.description: The name of the data sheet that will be shown in Excel

metaSheetName.name: metaSheetName
metaSheetName.description: The name of the metadata sheet that will be shown in Excel

metainfo.name: metainfo
metainfo.description: Optional Metadata that will be displayed in the additional Metadata Sheet

context.description: Export context that will be applied to the exported file

hierarchyLevel.name: hierarchyLevel
hierarchyLevel.description: Optional name of the property that contains hierarchy level information

dataSource.name: dataSource

sizeLimit.name: sizeLimit
sizeLimit.description: Maximal allowed number of records that can be obtained from the service in a single request

dataSource.description: Source of spreadsheet data. A JSON array, data source properties map, sap.ui.model.ListBinding, sap.ui.model.TreeBinding or URL to an OData source can be provided. For example, "someUrl" is an equivalent to {dataUrl:"someUrl", type:"OData"}. An instance of sap.ui.model.ListBinding or sap.ui.model.TreeBinding either has to implement a #getDownloadUrl function or needs to be a ClientListBinding. Note: sap.ui.model.ClientTreeBinding is not supported.

count.name: count
count.description: The maximal number of records to export

worker.name: worker
worker.description:
Run export process in a worker thread. Set to false to disable worker and run export in a main thread. This is needed, for example, if a mock server is used to provide spreadsheet data.
Note: In case of a strict content security policy, it is not always possible to create an export worker. In this case, export runs in a main thread disregarding the worker value.

fileName.name: fileName
fileName.description: Optional file name for the exported file

showProgress.name: showProgress
showProgress.description: Set to false to suppress the progress dialog

parameters.description: Export settings

events.name: beforeSave
events.description: The beforeSave event is fired just before the generated file is saved to the file system. This event allows you to prevent the default action that closes the ExportDialog and saves the file to your local device. If the default is prevented, the event handler is responsible for closing and destroying the Dialog.

methods.name: attachBeforeSave

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnHandler
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet#event:beforeSave} event of this sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet.
When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet itself.
This event is fired just before the generated file is saved to the file system.

methods.name: cancel

returnValue.description: - Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Cancels a running export process. This method does nothing if no export is running.

methods.name: detachBeforeSave

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnHandler
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet beforeSave} event of this sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet.
The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: getMimeType

returnValue.description: MIME type for Office Open XML Spreadsheet

methods.description: Returns the specific MIME type

methods.name: processDataSource

returnValue.description: - Valid dataSource object or null in case the dataSource configuration is not supported

parameters.name: oDataSource
parameters.description: Possible types are a plain string that contains an URL of an OData service, an array of JSON objects, a data source configuration, a sap.ui.model.ListBinding or sap.ui.model.TreeBinding

methods.description: Sets the data source configuration that will be used for exporting the data. If the passed parameter is null, the call will be ignored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.util.Filter
symbols.description: The sap.ui.export.util.Filter class represents filter settings that are used for the export. It provides the capability to have a visual representation of the filters in the exported document and offers convenience functions like sap.ui.export.util.Filter#setType to improve the result.

parameters.name: sProperty
parameters.description: Name of the technical filter property

parameters.name: vRawFilter

exclude.name: exclude
exclude.description: Defines whether it is an exclude filter

parameters.description: Raw filter object

parameters.name: sLabel
parameters.description: Optional label for the filter property

constructor.description: Representation of filter settings that are used for exporting.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.export.util.Filter with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.

methods.name: getLabel

returnValue.description: Filter label

methods.description: Returns the filter label if available. Otherwise the name of the filter property will be returned.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.export.util.Filter.

methods.name: getProperty

returnValue.description: Name of the property

methods.description: Returns the technical name of the property on which the filter is applied.

methods.name: getValue

returnValue.description: Formatted and semicolon-separated filter settings

methods.description: Returns the formatted filter value(s) as string. If there are multiple filters for the same property, which are combined via OR, it will return a semicolon-separated list of the filter values including their operators.

methods.name: setFormat

parameters.name: fnFormat
parameters.description: Format function that will be applied to the raw values

methods.description: Uses the given format function to format all filter values. The function has to accept a single parameter of type string and needs to return a string value. The function will be called for every single raw value without the corresponding filter operator. If there is a "between" filter, the function will be called twice. In case of an error, the function call will be skipped, and the raw value will be taken instead. The format function has priority over the type-dependent format. To reset the format function and return to type-dependent formatting, the format function needs to be set to null.

methods.name: setLabel

parameters.name: sLabel
parameters.description: Filter label

methods.description: Takes the given string as label of the filter.

methods.name: setType

parameters.name: oType
parameters.description: Type instance that is used for formatting

methods.description: Uses the given sap.ui.model.SimpleType instance to format the filter values accordingly.
